claim: Flublok ensures identical antigenic match with WHO- and FDA-selected flu strains.

rejected_evidence.quote: Flublok contains recombinant HA proteins of the three strains of influenza virus specified by health authorities for inclusion in the annual seasonal vaccine. These proteins function as antigens which induce a humoral immune response, measured by hemagglutination inhibition (HI) antibody).
rejected_evidence.original_explanation: This quote explicitly states that Flublok contains recombinant hemagglutinin (HA) proteins from the three influenza virus strains specified by health authorities, which include the WHO and FDA. This supports the claim that Flublok ensures an identical antigenic match with the strains selected by these organizations.

rejected_evidence.quote: Flublok is standardized according to United States Public Health Service (USPHS) requirements. For the 2024-2025 influenza season it is formulated to contain 135 mcg HA per 0.5 mL dose, with 45 mcg HA of each of the following 3 influenza virus strains: A/West Virginia 30 2022 (A/Wisconsin/67/2022 pdm 09 like virus) (H1N1), A/Massachusetts/18/2022 (H3N2) and B/Austria/1359417/2021.
rejected_evidence.original_explanation: This quote provides the exact strains included in Flublok for the 2024-2025 season, demonstrating that the vaccine is formulated to match the specific strains selected by public health authorities, which are based on WHO and FDA recommendations.
